alert.note: Alert for Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 23 at 10:57AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Vermont, including the following county, Windham. * WHEN...Until 200 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1057 AM EST, rain and snowmelt is occurring, and will cause minor flooding. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bellows Falls, Townshend, Putney, Saxtons River, Westminster, Newfane, West Wardsboro, Windham, Rockingham, Jamaica, Wardsboro, Grafton, Brookline, Athens, North Westminster, Simpsonville, Harmonyville, Townshend Dam, West Townshend and South Windham. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
